Title.evidence: Randomised Controlled Trial of Isolated Hepatic Perfusion with 5-FU and Oxaliplatin for Unresectable Metastatic Liver Lesions

Trial_Design.evidence: A standard 3 × 3 Phase I design was used.

Participants.evidence: Participants were patients with unresectable isolated colorectal cancer (CRC) liver metastases scheduled for hepatic artery infusion (HAI) pump, conducted at a single center.

Intervention.evidence: IHP involved fixed-dose oxaliplatin with escalating 5-FU doses.

Objective.evidence: This study aimed to evaluate the safety and maximum tolerated dose (MTD) of 5-FU with oxaliplatin via isolated hepatic perfusion (IHP) in patients with unresectable metastatic liver lesions.

Method_Outcome.evidence: The primary outcome was the MTD, assessed over a 6-month period.

Randomisation_Allocation.evidence: Randomisation and allocation concealment methods were not applicable.

Number_Analysed.evidence: At 6-month follow-up, 9 patients (82%) showed partial response, and 2 (18%) had stable disease.

Result_Outcome.evidence: The 1- and 2-year overall survival probabilities were 90.9% and 71.6%, respectively, with a median follow-up of 24 months.

Harms.evidence: Adverse events included 4 grade 3 and 1 grade 4 events.
